ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Familiarity with recent methodologies in musicology and thoughtful approaches to working with archival materials. Connection to major issues within the discipline and the overall humanities field.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is as much a skills course as a critical thinking course, and I enjoyed especially the wonderful practical sessions. The readings were quite good, but sometimes we didn't actually discuss them in favor of letting the discussion move where we wanted. I value this discussion flexibility, but there were some days when the discussion moved away from materials and towards general musicology. I appreciate the forum to discuss these general questions, but sometimes we got into a rut. On these occasions the discussion was dominated by too few people, but I saw that you did what you could and I didn't see what else you could do. I like the flexibility we had in our final projects, and enjoyed the day of presentations. It's always very interesting to see what my colleagues are doing. You kept the discussions very friendly and open, which made it easy to contribute. The system of requiring abstracts and bibliographies well in advance of the final project works well. It was great to have these frequent opportunities for feedback and it kept us on track. It was wonderful to have this introduction to Yale's resources and libraries. One wonders if it should be required for historians.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Great course that balances hands-on use of resources with intellectual dialogues on issues related to field.
